Package net.xqhs.util.logging

Interface Logger

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    LoggerClassic
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BaseLogger, DumbLogger, UnitComponent, UnitComponentExt
    public interface Logger
    Any class that offers simple logging services (lf-li-lw-le-lr-dbg) to an external entity should implement this interface.

    As with other logging infrastructures, the name of the primitive used indicates the level of importance of the message.

    All logging primitives (except the single-argument lr(Object)) accept a message as argument, as well as a number of Object arguments that will be placed, in the order in which they were passed, in the placeholders in the message. The placeholder string is specified by the constant ARGUMENT_PLACEHOLDER (currently "\\[\\]"). The result of call to the toString() method of the argument is placed between ARGUMENT_BEGIN and ARGUMENT_END.

    The performance of an implementation is strongly influenced by when string concatenation is performed. The role of the arguments argument in the logging primitives is to delay string concatenation (components of the message string and the various objects to place in it). Concatenation should only happen if the message is going to be displayed. While the level of the message will be relayed to the wrapped logger (depending on wrapper), messages should also be filtered in the class implementing this interface, such that the message string is only assembled if necessary.

    It works with a reduced set of levels: Logger.Level.TRACE, Logger.Level.INFO, Logger.Level.WARN, Logger.Level.ERROR, plus Logger.Level.OFF and Logger.Level.ALL for log settings.

    Author:
    Andrei Olaru

      static class  Logger.Level
      Indicates the level of the log.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static java.lang.String ARGUMENT_BEGIN
      The string to be added before the rendition of the argument in the message string.
      static java.lang.String ARGUMENT_END
      The string to be added after the rendition of the argument in the message string.
      static java.lang.String ARGUMENT_PLACEHOLDER
      The substring in the message string that will be replaced with the various specified arguments.
      static java.lang.Character AWESOME_SEPARATOR
      A special character that is used to separate log lines when sending log output to the reporting entity.
      static LogWrapper.LoggerType DEFAULT_LOGGER_WRAPPER
      The default log wrapper, as one of LogWrapper.LoggerType.
      static int INCLUDE_DETAILED_TIME
      Include in the output the time of the message, in a detail form (e.g.
      static int INCLUDE_NAME
      Include in the output the name of the log / of the unit producing the message.
      static int INCLUDE_TIMESTAMP
      Include in the output the system timestamp of the message.
      static int REPLACE_ENDLINES
      Replace in the output the endlines between messages with AWESOME_SEPARATOR.

    • Field Detail

      • ARGUMENT_PLACEHOLDER

        static final java.lang.String ARGUMENT_PLACEHOLDER
        The substring in the message string that will be replaced with the various specified arguments. This must be a regular expression.

        Constant Field Values

      • INCLUDE_NAME

        static final int INCLUDE_NAME
        Include in the output the name of the log / of the unit producing the message.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • INCLUDE_DETAILED_TIME

        static final int INCLUDE_DETAILED_TIME
        Include in the output the time of the message, in a detail form (e.g. HH:MM:SS.ssss or similar).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • INCLUDE_TIMESTAMP

        static final int INCLUDE_TIMESTAMP
        Include in the output the system timestamp of the message.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        static final int REPLACE_ENDLINES
        Replace in the output the endlines between messages with AWESOME_SEPARATOR.

        static final LogWrapper.LoggerType DEFAULT_LOGGER_WRAPPER
        The default log wrapper, as one of LogWrapper.LoggerType.

      • AWESOME_SEPARATOR

        static final java.lang.Character AWESOME_SEPARATOR
        A special character that is used to separate log lines when sending log output to the reporting entity.

    • Method Detail

      • le

        void le​(java.lang.String message,
        java.lang.Object... arguments)
        Outputs an error message.
        Parameters:
        message - : the message string. Apparitions of the ARGUMENT_PLACEHOLDER will be replaced with instances in arguments, in the order in which they appear, by calling their Object.toString() method.
        arguments - : the arguments to be placed in the placeholders of the message string. Remaining arguments will be added after the message.

      • lw

        void lw​(java.lang.String message,
        java.lang.Object... arguments)
        Outputs a warning message.
        Parameters:
        message - : the message string. Apparitions of the ARGUMENT_PLACEHOLDER will be replaced with instances in arguments, in the order in which they appear, by calling their Object.toString() method.
        arguments - : the arguments to be placed in the placeholders of the message string. Remaining arguments will be added after the message.

      • li

        void li​(java.lang.String message,
        java.lang.Object... arguments)
        Outputs an info message.
        Parameters:
        message - : the message string. Apparitions of the ARGUMENT_PLACEHOLDER will be replaced with instances in arguments, in the order in which they appear, by calling their Object.toString() method.
        arguments - : the arguments to be placed in the placeholders of the message string. Remaining arguments will be added after the message.

      • lf

        void lf​(java.lang.String message,
        java.lang.Object... arguments)
        Outputs a 'fine' logging message.
        Parameters:
        message - : the message string. Apparitions of the ARGUMENT_PLACEHOLDER will be replaced with instances in arguments, in the order in which they appear, by calling their Object.toString() method.
        arguments - : the arguments to be placed in the placeholders of the message string. Remaining arguments will be added after the message.

      • lr

        java.lang.Object lr​(java.lang.Object ret)
        Outputs a fine logging message just before returning the Object in the argument.

        This method is supposed to be used in return statements, e.g. return lr(value);

        The message will contain the Object in the argument.

        Parameters:
        ret - : the Object to return and to display.
        Returns:
        the Object passed as argument.

      • lr

        java.lang.Object lr​(java.lang.Object ret,
                    java.lang.String message,
                    java.lang.Object... arguments)
        Outputs a fine logging message just before returning the Object in the argument.

        This method is supposed to be used in return statements, e.g. return lr(value, message);

        The Object in the argument is also put in the log message, in a form decided by the implementation.

        Parameters:
        ret - : the Object to return and to display.
        message - : the message to display beside the Object. Apparitions of the ARGUMENT_PLACEHOLDER will be replaced with instances in arguments, in the order in which they appear, by calling their Object.toString() method.
        arguments - : the arguments to be placed in the placeholders of the message string. Remaining arguments will be added after the message.
        Returns:
        the Object passed as argument.

      • ler

        boolean ler​(boolean ret,
            java.lang.String message,
            java.lang.Object... arguments)
        This method should be used in return statements for error cases. It adds an error log message just before returning the value in the first argument.
        Parameters:
        ret - : the value to return.
        message - : the message to display. Logger.Level.ERROR will be used. Apparitions of the ARGUMENT_PLACEHOLDER will be replaced with instances in arguments, in the order in which they appear, by calling their Object.toString() method.
        arguments - : the arguments to be placed in the placeholders of the message string. Remaining arguments will be added after the message.
        Returns:
        the Object passed as argument.

      • dbg

        void dbg​(Debug.DebugItem debug,
         java.lang.String message,
         java.lang.Object... arguments)
        Outputs a fine logging message only if the specified Debug.DebugItem is activated.
        Parameters:
        debug - : the Debug.DebugItem
        message - : the message string. Apparitions of the ARGUMENT_PLACEHOLDER will be replaced with instances in arguments, in the order in which they appear, by calling their Object.toString() method.
        arguments - : the arguments to be placed in the placeholders of the message string. Remaining arguments will be added after the message.
